pageContext.claim: “We're not going to be losing our Second Amendment. They're going to get rid of it. You know who they put it in charge? Beto. Remember Beto? Beto O'Rourke.”
pageContext.analysis: Former Rep. Beto O'Rourke (D-Tex.) called for mandatory buy-backs of assault weapons when he was running for president but he has not been placed "in charge of the Second Amendment" in a potential Biden administration. When a gun rights advocate accused Biden of wanting to take away guns, he shot back: “You're full of [expletive]. I'm not taking your gun away, at all." Trump supporters circulated a video purporting to show Biden saying that if he wins he’s coming for our guns. What he is saying is that “he’s coming” for O’Rourke, if he’s elected President. This is in reference to Biden’s interest in having O'Rourke be part of his potential future team.
